results.title: Long Shadows the Legacy of the American Civil War
results.brief_description: A documentary examining the legacy of the American Civil War and its effect upon the politics and people of the south in the 1980s. Interviews with Robert Penn Warren, Studs Terkel, Jimmy Carter and others.

results.title: London terminus
results.brief_description: From London a vast national railway system radiates: at the railway terminus in London, 1,704 trains enter and leave the station every day. Millions of urban workers depend entirely on the railway system for their daily transport to and from central London, and, in addition, there are many expresses and goods trains which span the length and breadth of Great Britain. Music composed by Horace Somerville, played by London Symphony Orchestra under Muir Mathieson.

results.title: Living Tomorrow : Intermediate Technology (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ken Ashton, Mike Murray and Bob Thorpe
results.brief_description: Our modern high tech. society endlessly devours the landscape, yet the English intermediate technology group, Living Tomorrow, is determined that the developing world should not waste its precious resources in the same way. Demonstrates some of the developments in intermediate technology for use in both the first and third worlds.

results.title: Living reptile: the locomotion of snakes
results.creator_credit: James A. Oliver and New York Zoological Society
results.brief_description: This study of snake locomotion opens by showing the typical four-legged method of locomotion of animals and how it is related to the serpentine motion of the snake. Described in detail are the serpentine motion, employed by all snakes; the caterpillar motion used by some such as the Reticulated Python and the Puff Adder; the side-winding motion used chiefly by heaby-bodied desert snakes, and the hitch-and-hike or concertina method used by some snakes in climbing trees.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James A. Oliver and New York Zoological Society

results.title: Living in memory
results.brief_description: Ray Barrett delivers a potted history of Australia at war, via the exhibits in the Australian War Museum. The film begins in the 1890s and continues through to the Vietnam war mentioning aspects of the Boer War, World War I including Gallipoli, World War II, and the wars in Korea, North Borneo and Malaysia.
